page.title: 01The Parish of Thurning
page.content: Thurning has appproximately 75 people. There are five arable farmers, 1 pig farmer. All farms are intensive arable. Crops grown are wheat, barley, sugar beet, potatoes. New crop grown more is oil seed rape used in margarine. Fields are very big - 40 acres or more to accommodate big tractors, combines, and other implements in the 1980's less people work on the land because one big machine can do the work of many men. There are 6 fulltime men on the 5 farms, some casual work at harvest time. No hedges left to preserve wild life. Soil varies from light to meduim. 4 small areas of woodland. Some new trees have been planted. The landscape is mostly flat. a disused railway line runs through Thurning also the rivers Bure and Blackwater.
